channel.title: [vb]Two diff forms interacting with eachother?
channel.description:
This is my noobie question of the week:
I am making an rpg game for Computer Science, and we need to have a item inventory. I could easily do this in a single form but it needs to be a seperate form. All I need to know is, how can I make the two forms interact? Lets say you picked up an item, how would you make the item go into another form?
Thanks...

item.title: [vb]Two diff forms interacting with eachother?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Freddy, if by some chance blitzmax’s 3d module comes out soon then you can use that cuz it’ll be using all latest technology(sorta) with directx9. It’s a very neat programming language but I never bought the compiler for it yet. Or you can even use opengl with it.

Read full topic

item.title: [vb]Two diff forms interacting with eachother?
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

DirectX7 ey?
I was hoping for DirectX9, but I think I’ll try it, and if i dun like it i can still go for vb

Read full topic

item.title: [vb]Two diff forms interacting with eachother?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Yes, it is a BASIC language, I heard most similar to qbasic, with a few twists of C.

It’s just so damn easy to make a simple game with it though. You can make a simple 3d game without even having 3d models too, thats one of the things I love about it(it’s great for making puzzle games). And it is very limited, but half the fun I find in it is going past it’s limitations(Directx7 is extremely limited if you haven’t noticed).

And when I said completly different then VB, I meant making a game-wise. You can make better and quicker games, 5 times easier.

Read full topic

item.title: [vb]Two diff forms interacting with eachother?
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

jme_009:

Blitz3d is COMPLETLY different from Vb.

Hmm, dunno that
Maybe that’d be better for my game i’m going to make next month intsead of vb + directx

jme_009:

It’s just that I just started VB, our teacher never gae us any help at all, so it makes it diffacult.

I own my teacher at vb antough we never got vb, just elan “educational laguage”, some simplified pascal crap, and pascal is already simplified O_o

jme_009:

We have a text book, but the most advanced thing in it is making a calculator, which took like 5 minutes from my own knowledge.

5 Minutes?!? Lol, speed up a bit m8

EDIT: Hmm, this stuff looks like it’s based on vb or something, well atleast it uses vbscript…
I could like this =)

Read full topic

item.title: [vb]Two diff forms interacting with eachother?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Blitz3d is COMPLETLY different from Vb.

It’s designed purely for games, so… Yeah And like everything you need has a simple code to it.

It’s just that I just started VB, our teacher never gae us any help at all, so it makes it diffacult. We have a text book, but the most advanced thing in it is making a calculator, which took like 5 minutes from my own knowledge.

PS, The game is due on friday. I’m almost done. Just getting sprites to work better, and then adding in random battles(the current system I have so retarded. You automatically fight every minute) It’s pretty lame, all I ahve so far is a flash movie intro, that shows you as a thief sneaking into a palace to steal the trasure. The first roo you sneak by guards, if they see you then you die Next room has random arrows shooting out from the walls, you just dodge them, kinda like frogger, then you end up in a basement, then that leads to a cave full of monsters, which then leads you to a boss, which then leads you to another room with the treasure and a ladder that brings you back up to the surface, lol. And thats all

Quite often I can do semi-advanced stuff, while I cant do crappy lil things. For example, I am grade 10, going into 11, and I still dont understand Long Division, rofl. Calculator ftw!

Read full topic

item.title: [vb]Two diff forms interacting with eachother?
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:3, topic:3616”][quote author=Chrisface link=topic=4377.msg44011#msg44011 date=1149580083]
You don’t have to make them “interact” all you have to do is add form1. to the start of whatever.

Eg, read text from an edit box in one form you do

theVar := form1.edit1.text;

or maybe you want something like this:

form2.item1.text := form1.newItem.text;

You’l have to work out how your handeling all your items and stuff which i doubt you’l know how to do if you didn’t know how to do this form thing.

[/quote]

Thanks

I know how to work out the items. It’s just that the teacher never told us how to do the form thing.[/quote]
Lol, jme, u’re an afelhem developer (right?) but still you keep suprising me with ut noobie questions every week, lol
How u manage to get in?

Read full topic

item.title: [vb]Two diff forms interacting with eachother?
item.dc:creator: @Chrisface Chrisface
item.description:
@Chrisface wrote:

You don’t have to make them “interact” all you have to do is add form1. to the start of whatever.

Eg, read text from an edit box in one form you do

theVar := form1.edit1.text;

or maybe you want something like this:

form2.item1.text := form1.newItem.text;

You’l have to work out how your handeling all your items and stuff which i doubt you’l know how to do if you didn’t know how to do this form thing.
